reviewText: Awesome!!
This works out great as an advent devotional.  My family watched 10 minute segments each night and all of us were touched by it.
Wonderful insight into the birth and life of Christ and those involved in His earthly life.
I liked it but my children got bored. It is not for children.

Really good Christmas stories and biblical teachings from Max Lucado who is a master at telling a good story making it feel as if you were right there with Mary, Joseph and little baby Jesus. Max tells the Bible stories in peaceful settings around British churches and churchyards. Wonderful series.
The greatest story ever told in basic language for the little ones!
Enlightenment.

There aren't very many options for Advent themed, Adult curriculum. So, I tried this. It is pieces of some longer project patched together into six too-long sessions. It is boring and repetitive--there are actually segments used more than once in the patchwork. Some interesting history (Saint Nicolas), but mostly just a long series of questions that try to get you into the perspective of Mary and Joseph. Too many questions at once, with no time to process really. All in all, it's not well suited for Adult Sunday School and definitely not suited for use at home with the kids. Not much effort was put into the production, so it's monotonous.
I really didn't expect someone reading a book on video.  Boring.

Profound insights into the marvelous grace of the incarnation with the superb articulation and creative expression Lucado is known for!  This was shown in a Church Bible study group in the weeks leading up to Christmas and was such a blessing that many wanted to see it again in their homes.  This copy was purchased as a Christmas gift for a couple who couldn't attend the study sessions, and the recipients were thrilled.
I enjoyed this very much.
I think that it was inspirational.  Best to only listen to once session at a time.  Excellent questions to ponder.
Good
Loved the messages, would love to see more like this in amazon. Full family can huddle together and watch this.
Max Lucado is a good teacher.
Nice focus on Jesus during Christmas instead of Santa.
Beautiful teaching on the greatest love story ever!
not very good
Very uplifting film....great reminder of the reason for our Christmas celebrations
Love it
Very accurate to the Bible. Telling man kind that God did it all.
A great review of God's son given for mankind.  As well as the love & intent for all.  Enjoyed it, and it being available at Christmas.

Beautifully done. Best to use it daily during the Advent season as it is more meaningful used in that way. Max Lucado has some wonderful insights into the biblical characters which reminds us that they were common human beings just like all of us. I will use this series for years to come at Advent time.
Max Lucado is a wonderful story teller and he really shares some heart-warming stories about Jesus. The only problem with this story is the narrative is unnecessarily chopped up into odd segments.
Very moving. Gives you a lot to think about
I admire Max for his faith-filled insight, but was pleasantly surprised at this wonderful presentation of the beauty of the Na
Excellent as always!
Exceptional!!
A wonderful movie on Christmas hope
It was amazing! I watched it all the way through and felt God speaking through it to me.
